byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo.

abstract: Egyptian authorities release Mohamed Soltan, American citizen who spent nearly two years in prison after being accused of partaking in Islamist protest against removal of Pres Mohamed Morsi in 2013; Soltan publicized details of hunger strike he began in 2014 through smuggled letters and was supported by human rights groups and Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Soltan, who was arrested during the protests over the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi, gained attention through letters smuggled out of prison.

headline.main: Mohamed Soltan, U.S. Citizen Imprisoned in Egypt, Is Released
headline.print_headline: Egypt Releases and Deports U.S. Citizen Jailed for Nearly 2 Years Over Protest

snippet: Mr. Soltan, who was arrested during the protests over the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi, gained attention through letters smuggled out of prison.
